title: conda install fails - HTTP 000 CONNECTION FAILED
body_html:
I'm trying to get set up on a brand new install of ubuntu 16.04 on a slow and unreliable connection.

`
$ conda install -y pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch
Fetching package metadata .............
Solving package specifications: .

Package plan for installation in environment /home/minthos/miniconda3:

The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

cuda90:       1.0-h6433d27_0                              pytorch
freetype:     2.8-hab7d2ae_1                                     
intel-openmp: 2018.0.0-hc7b2577_8                                
jpeg:         9b-h024ee3a_2                                      
libpng:       1.6.32-hbd3595f_4                                  
libtiff:      4.0.9-h28f6b97_0                                   
mkl:          2018.0.1-h19d6760_4                                
numpy:        1.13.3-py36ha12f23b_0                              
olefile:      0.44-py36h79f9f78_0                                
pillow:       4.3.0-py36h6f462bf_1                               
pytorch:      0.3.0-py36_cuda9.0.176_cudnn7.0.3hdc18817_4 pytorch [cuda90]
torchvision:  0.2.0-py36h17b6947_1                        pytorch

pytorch-0.3.0- 100% |###########################################################################################| Time: 0:02:40 3.59 MB/s
pytorch-0.3.0- 100% |###########################################################################################| Time: 0:01:30 6.40 MB/s
pytorch-0.3.0- 100% |###########################################################################################| Time: 0:02:26 3.95 MB/s

CondaError: CondaHTTPError: HTTP 000 CONNECTION FAILED for url https://conda.anaconda.org/pytorch/linux-64/pytorch-0.3.0-py36_cuda9.0.176_cudnn7.0.3hdc18817_4.tar.bz2
Elapsed: -

An HTTP error occurred when trying to retrieve this URL.
HTTP errors are often intermittent, and a simple retry will get you on your way.

CondaError: CondaHTTPError: HTTP 000 CONNECTION FAILED for url https://conda.anaconda.org/pytorch/linux-64/pytorch-0.3.0-py36_cuda9.0.176_cudnn7.0.3hdc18817_4.tar.bz2
Elapsed: -

An HTTP error occurred when trying to retrieve this URL.
HTTP errors are often intermittent, and a simple retry will get you on your way.

CondaError: CondaHTTPError: HTTP 000 CONNECTION FAILED for url https://conda.anaconda.org/pytorch/linux-64/pytorch-0.3.0-py36_cuda9.0.176_cudnn7.0.3hdc18817_4.tar.bz2
Elapsed: -

An HTTP error occurred when trying to retrieve this URL.
HTTP errors are often intermittent, and a simple retry will get you on your way.

`

Well, a simple retry isn't enough. I even left it running overnight using this: while true; do conda install -y pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch; done but it seems it's not able to resume a failed download so it never finishes.

Trying to download the file manually using wget -c https://conda.anaconda.org/pytorch/linux-64/pytorch-0.3.0-py36_cuda9.0.176_cudnn7.0.3hdc18817_4.tar.bz2 seems to work for a little while, then I get:

Read error at byte 359014594/578635335 (Connection reset by peer). Retrying.

followed by

HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 403 Forbidden

So maybe I should leave that running in a while script overnight as well.. Anyway, I figured I'd let you guys know. It would be nice if the 3rd world could participate in AI development as well.
